description: At a campaign rally in 2022, the two most popular politicians in the Philippines praised each other as they forged a formidable ticket in the presidential election.
title: Marcos-Duterte Showdown Signals Trouble Ahead for Philippines

description: Japan may again postpone a decision on hoisting taxes to help cover rising defense spending, a senior ruling coalition official said, raising more questions about how Tokyo intends to pay for a historic expansion of its military capabilities.
title: Japan Wobbles on Tax Hikes to Pay For Historic Defense Build-Up

description: Australia’s controversial new law barring under-16s from social media is one of the toughest crackdowns yet on platforms including Facebook and TikTok as governments worldwide grasp for ways to protect children from harmful content.
title: TikTok, Meta Brace for Fallout From Australia’s Social Media Ban

description: Namibia extended voting in presidential and parliamentary elections by two days in some areas that were impacted by procedural delays.
title: Namibia Extends Vote in Areas Impacted by Procedural Delays

description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz urged Thyssenkrupp AG to reconsider plans for more job cuts in its steel unit and promised to continue the government’s push to cap grid charges for energy-intensive companies.
title: Scholz Calls on Thyssenkrupp to Keep Jobs, Supports Grid Fee Cap

description: South Sudan President Salva Kiir called on the population to remain calm amid rumors that the dismissal of a number of top military officials may trigger violence in the conflict-prone nation.
title: South Sudan President Calls for Calm Amid Rumors of Army Tension

description: Foreign direct investment into Canada remained steady in the third quarter, an encouraging sign that businesses continued to park capital in the northern nation even as uncertainty mounted ahead of the US election.
title: Foreign Investment Into Canada Steadied Ahead of Trump Election

description: Marine Le Pen’s National Rally set out further demands for changes to the French government’s 2025 budget bill after Prime Minister Michel Barnier dropped plans to raise taxes on electricity in a key concession.
title: Le Pen’s Party Makes More Budget Demands as Barnier Gives Ground

description: Johann Rupert, chairman and founder of Richemont, said the extension of a trade pact that gives South Africa and more than 30 other nations from the continent duty-free access to the world’s biggest economy is vital for his home country.
title: Tycoon Rupert Says Extension of US Pact Vital for South Africa

description: Mexico has not received a “firm” project proposal from a Chinese automotive company to install a plant in Mexico, said President Claudia Sheinbaum on Thursday.
title: Sheinbaum Says that BYD’s Plan for Mexico Plant Isn’t “Firm”

description: Romania became a target of a cyberattack aimed at influencing its presidential elections that propelled a pro-Russian candidate to win the first round of the ballot, the nation’s Supreme Defense Council said on Thursday.
title: Romania Says It Was a Target of Cyberattack in Presidential Vote

description: Georgia’s government said it won’t enter into talks on joining the European Union for four years, in a move that deepens questions over the future path of the Black Sea nation.
title: Georgian Ruling Party Delays EU Membership Talks Until 2028

description: Valeo SA plans to cut about 1,000 jobs in Europe and close two plants in France, citing a gloomy outlook for the car industry and a loss of competitiveness in the region in the face of cheaper Chinese products.
title: Valeo to Cut Jobs on ‘Massive’ Loss of European Competitiveness

description: Cyprus wants to be ready for the possibility of becoming a NATO member, President Nikos Christodoulides said Thursday, even though Turkey pledges to veto such a move.
title: Cyprus Considers NATO Application Despite Certain Turkish Veto

description: Norway has agreed to bear half of the responsibility of protecting the main transit hub for foreign military aid to Ukraine, according to Poland’s Prime Minister Donald Tusk.
title: Norway to Help Protect Key Ukraine Aid Hub in Poland, Tusk Says

description: A recent slump in the ruble is ramping up pressure on the Bank of Russia to hike its key rate — potentially by the most since the start of the war on Ukraine.
title: Ruble’s Plunge Pressures Bank of Russia for Steeper Rate Hike

description: Romania’s Constitutional Court ordered a recount of all the votes in the first round of the presidential election, which was won by a little-known pro-Russian candidate, deepening the political crisis in the country.
title: Romanian Top Court Orders a Recount in Presidential Election

description: The head of the Russian Orthodox Church Patriarch Kirill issued a rare rebuke to state officials over their nuclear threats to the West.
title: Russian Church Leader Rebukes Officials Over Nuclear Threats

description: A cease-fire between Israel and Lebanon’s Hezbollah has brought calm to the countries’ border area, though reactions were varied from the many thousands displaced by the conflict on both sides.
title: Lebanese Defy Warnings to Rush Back Home After Israel Cease-Fire

description: Australia’s social media ban for children under the age of 16 will become law after passing the Senate, the upper house of Parliament, even as questions linger over how the new restrictions will be implemented.
title: Australia’s Social Media Ban for Under 16s to Become Law

description: Nigeria’s security forces used excessive force to quell demonstrations against high living costs, with evidence suggesting the police were “shooting to kill,” Amnesty International said.
title: Nigerian Forces ‘Shot to Kill’ During Protests, Amnesty Says

description: France’s efforts to repair its public finances are threatening a new political and financial crisis, prompting investors to sell some of the nation’s assets.
title: Why France’s Political and Budget Drama Is Spooking Investors

description: President Vladimir Putin warned that his forces could strike “decision-making centers” in the Ukrainian capital of Kyiv with new ballistic missiles as retaliation for attacks on Russia using Western missiles.
title: Putin Warns Russia May Strike Kyiv With New Ballistic Missiles

description: Giorgia Meloni is scrambling to prevent Italian coalition tensions from breaking into the open after a junior partner sided with the opposition to defeat a government proposal.
title: Meloni Tries to Dampen Coalition Tensions After Vote Defeat

description: Austrian anti-corruption prosecutors accepted a plea bargain from former state holding company executive Thomas Schmid in a setback to ex-Chancellor Sebastian Kurz.
title: Ex-CEO Becomes Key Witness in Investigation Into Austria’s Kurz

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Europe Doubts Trump on US Military Aid to Kyiv

description: Georgian lawmakers approved Irakli Kobakhidze to continue as prime minister even as members of the opposition pressed on with a boycott in protest of last month’s parliamentary election results.
title: Georgia Ruling Party Approves Cabinet With Kobakhidze as Premier

description: Mozambique’s main border crossing with South Africa was blocked for a second day on Thursday due to political unrest, the highway concessionaire said.
title: Unrest Blocks Mozambique’s South African Border for a Second Day

description: The number of long-term migrants arriving in the UK slipped in the year to June, but remained historically high despite curbs introduced by the last Conservative government.
title: UK Net Migration Still Near Historic High Despite Tory Curbs

description: French Finance Minister Antoine Armand said he’s prepared to make concessions on the 2025 budget bill to avoid opposition parties bringing down the government.
title: French Government Weighs Concessions to Avert Budget Crisis

description: China has abruptly suspended Miao Hua from the nation’s apex military body led by President Xi Jinping, ramping up a graft probe that’s roiling the upper echelons of the People’s Liberation Army.
title: China Probes Top Military Official Overseeing Political Loyalty

description: The sound of explosions could be heard in Kyiv Thursday morning as Russia targeted Ukraine’s power system in a new air assault, the second large-scale barrage this month.
title: Russia Targets Ukraine’s Power System With New Missile Barrage

description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s ruling party has seen its support eroded further against the upstart formation of his challenger Peter Magyar, an opinion poll published Thursday showed.
title: Orban Challenger Magyar’s Party Takes Double-Digit Poll Lead

description: Washington’s decision to ease its travel warning for China removes an obstacle to exchanges of people between the world’s two largest economies but will likely face new scrutiny once Donald Trump returns to the White House.
title: US Declares China Travel Safer But Trump Era Brings Uncertainty

description: Computer chips are the engine room of the digital economy, and their growing capabilities are enabling technologies such as generative artificial intelligence that promise to transform multiple industries. Their critical role was highlighted when the coronavirus pandemic disrupted chip production in Asia, tipping global technology supply chains into chaos.
title: Why the World’s Powers Are Locked in a Battle Over Computer Chips

description: European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde suggested European Union might be in a better position if it talks with the US about potential trade tariffs instead of immediately imposing countermeasures.
title: ECB’s Lagarde Urges Europe to Negotiate, Not Retaliate on Trade

description: Joko Widodo’s son-in-law won a regional gubernatorial election in Indonesia, becoming the latest of the popular former president’s relations to take a high-profile position in the country.
title: Ex-President Jokowi’s Son-in-Law Wins Governor Vote in Indonesia

description: The Nordics and Baltics are leading the way by stockpiling grain, testing payment systems and getting households to store emergency rations.
title: Europe Drills Its Citizens for the New Cold War

description: Canada’s premiers are urging Prime Minister Justin Trudeau to step up border security and defense spending to assuage US President-elect Donald Trump’s concerns, with the leader of the largest province calling the federal government “slow to react” and “stuck on its back foot.”
title: Canada’s Premiers Urge Trudeau to Strengthen Border Security After Trump Tariff Threat

description: Donald Trump had dinner with Meta Platforms Inc. Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg at the president-elect’s Mar-a-Lago estate in Florida on Wednesday.
title: Trump Has Dinner With Mark Zuckerberg at Mar-a-Lago

description: The start of an extraordinary diet session will likely give Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda an opportunity to steer expectations related to rate policy at a time when market bets on a near-term hike have been ramping higher.
title: Special Diet Session to Give Ueda Chance to Steer Market on Rate

description: The Biden administration is weighing additional curbs on sales of semiconductor equipment and AI memory chips to China that would escalate the US crackdown on Beijing’s tech ambitions but stop short of some stricter measures previously considered, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: US Preps China Chip Curbs That Stop Short of Early Proposals

description: Australia’s government will hold talks with its Northern Territory counterpart on Thursday over concerns around the financial status of Chinese company Landbridge, which holds a 99-year lease over the strategically-important port of Darwin.
title: Australia Concerned by Reports Port of Darwin’s Owner in Trouble

description: The Bank of Korea surprised investors by cutting its benchmark interest rate Thursday after delivering gloomier growth forecasts in a back-to-back move following its policy pivot last month.
title: BOK Surprises With Rate Cut as Trump Win Boosts Trade Risks

description: UK tech firms have asked the government to take further action to improve companies’ access to capital, as Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves hopes to boost stock market listings and bolster the UK’s business competitiveness.
title: Tech Firms Tell Reeves to Ease Access to Capital in Growth Push

description: The UK government has announced a crackdown on rogue employers who have been exploiting migrant workers, banning offenders from hiring any more overseas staff.
title: UK Launches Crackdown on Firms Exploiting Migrant Workers
